title: 9 of the Best Hip Hop Songs for Your Next Workout
summary: Jumping Jack is a fast-paced song with an energizing beat that will help you push through your workout. Eminem - Lose Yourself is arguably one of the best hip hop songs of all time. The Beastie Boysâ€™ Girls is an iconic song from the 90s that has stood the test of time. It is a great tune for almost every type of workout, especially cardio activities like running, cycling, and swimming. It also makes an excellent warm-up song for any workout session.

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Jumping Jack"),mdx("p",null,`Jumping Jack is a popular song from the 90s, and is a great tune for jumping jacks in your next workout session. It has a nice, upbeat rhythm that makes you want to move to the music as soon as it starts playing.
This song is best to play when you want to get your blood pumping and increase your heart rate, especially when you are starting out with a new workout routine. It will help you stay motivated and push you until the end of your workout session.`),mdx("p",null,`Why This is a Good Song for a Workout?

Jumping Jack is a great song for cardio workouts like jumping jacks, running, and cycling.`),mdx("h2",null,"Run-DMC - Trampoline"),mdx("p",null,`Trampoline is a 90s classic that is guaranteed to keep you grooving as you jump on the trampoline. relatedArticles.title: "The Grapes of Wrath" Is a Classic of American Literature
"The Hateful Eight" Is a Quentin Tarantino Tour De Force
"The Imitation Game" Is a Fascinating Look at the Life of Alan Turing

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In 1937, Alan Turing was born in Northern England. He would go on to become a war hero, pioneer of computer science, and one of the greatest minds of the 20th century. In 1951, he was convicted of \u201Cgross indecency\u201D and chemically castrated as punishment. Two years later, he killed himself with cyanide. This is his story.
Turing was a brilliant man with many interests that went beyond mathematics and computer science: chess, cryptography, music theory and programming computers to sing are just some examples. This diverse background helped him crack the Nazi Enigma code during World War II at Bletchley Park (which has been nicknamed "Codebreaking Castle"). This saved countless lives and accelerated the end of the war by two years. After the war ended in 1945, Turing continued working as an cryptanalyst for a few more years before turning his attention to other interests \u2013- and it is these interests that led to his arrest and untimely death at age 41.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Chvrches' 'Love Is Dead' Is a Pop Gem

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In today\u2019s musical landscape, popular electronic music has taken over the pop world. But there are still some great pop albums that aren\u2019t filled with auto-tune and EDM drops.On May 25th, the Scottish band Chvrches released their third album called \u201C Love is Dead.\u201D The synth-pop band has lots of happy vibes and catchy hooks on their new album. It\u2019s a pleasant listen but might not be what you expect if you only know them from their first two albums. The band took a left turn creatively, covering topics like technology, isolation and death rather than dancing around in your bedroom to this record.
Chvrses has gained more popularity among a different group of fans by releasing this album than they ever did with their first two releases combined. This is partially because they have expanded their audience by collaborating on songs with Haim and Bleachers recently as well as making this change in sound so now they have crossover appeal to radio listeners too!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Foster the People's 'Sacred Hearts Club' Is a Fun Ride
Father John Misty's 'Pure Comedy' Is a Hilarious Masterpiece
A-Trak's 'in My Feelings' Is a Summer Bop You Need in Your Life
"The Theory of Everything" Is a Touching Biopic of Stephen Hawking
Charlie Puth's 'Voicenotes' Is a Solid Effort

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Charlie Puth has been on a roll lately, with three top 40 hits in the last two years. He\u2019s also worked with some pretty big names (including one we\u2019ll get to shortly). Now, he\u2019s back with another new album, titled \u201CVoicenotes.\u201D It\u2019s a solid effort that shows growth and maturity, as well as keeping Puth\u2019s fun and lighthearted style.
At its core, Voicenotes is an acoustic pop album. However, it goes deeper than just putting electric guitars aside; these songs are stripped right down to the bare bones. There\u2019s still plenty of production value\u2014especially on the third track\u2014but it feels like Puth made a conscious decision not to hide behind anything.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "The Big Short" Is a Searing Indictment of the Financial Industry

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The film version of The Big Short hits theaters this Friday, and it\u2019s not subtle. Its tagline is \u201CThere\u2019s a sucker born every minute. But they don\u2019t grow up thinking they can be con men. They get taught to be one.\u201D And its trailer goes on to say, \u201CThe housing bubble was about to burst\u2026 And a group of misfits saw it coming. Now these unlikely heroes must band together and bring down the greedy villains who crashed the world economy\u2026 Before anyone else gets hurt.\u201D
Unfortunately, that last part is not hyperbole. The actions of unscrupulous financial engineers \u2014 colloquially known as \u201Cbankers\u201D \u2014 led directly to the Great Recession in 2008, which cost millions their jobs and homes, while triggering widespread deflation and anemic growth throughout much of the developed world for years thereafter.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
